name: Quantum Nexum
description:
A short puzzle game made in 48 hours for the 2021 GMTK Game Jam.

Note: Unfortunately due to a misconfigured compiler this will probably not run without MinGW installed though if you have the time its worth trying. If for whatever reason your dying to play it you can try installing MinGW and it should work though I would not recommend it since its kind of a pain. When the jam is over I might get around to uploading a working version.

The game is about quantum connections where different objects can be joined over a distance to interact in different ways.

Controls are:

WASD for movement

E to attract boxes to you when they are near

R to reset the level

Q to toggle level select

Use A and D to select levels while in level select

Written in c++ using raylib for graphics.
